title: OIDC Malformed q_session cookie causes HTTP 500 Internal Server Error
body:
### Describe the bug

When using quarkus-oidc, a malformed value of the q_session cookie can result in an internal server error.

### Expected behavior

Malformed value of a q_session cookie never causes an internal server error, but only a "not authenticated" response.
Instead, the cookie is deleted such that users can recover from the presence of a malformed cookie.

### Actual behavior

Malformed q_session cookie causes internal server error.

### How to Reproduce?

Use following settings:
````
quarkus.oidc.application-type=web-app
quarkus.oidc.token-state-manager.encryption-required=false
````

Usually, the q_session cookie should have the format {id_token}|{access_token}|{refresh_token}
However, now manipulate the q_session cookie such that is has the following format: {id_token} (i.e. remove the bars |)
(This is the format the q_session cookie has when encryption is activated for instance).

The application response with Internal Server Error, caused by ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.
